item.title: Marais Executioner's Sword Build Guide in Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Pros and Cons of Marais Executioner's Sword
  • Best Off-hand Weapon with Marais Executioner's Sword.
  • Best Stats for Marais Executioner's Sword
  • Best Armor for Marais Executioner's Sword
  • Best Talismans For Marais Executioner's Sword
  • Best Cracked Tears With Marais Executioner's Sword

Marais Executioner's Sword was already a demi-god shredding chainsaw in the base game of Elden Ring . Using its Ash of War felt like you were tearing through bosses with a massive drill rather than a Greatsword. With the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, this weapon has gotten a few new toys to play with that make it an even better deity-destroying armament than it previously was.

If you've been looking for a good weapon that can pulverize bosses into ground beef, then Marais Executioner's Sword is just the weapon you're looking for. Its Ash of War has a unique blend of mechanics that make it perfect to power up with just the right build. Here's a guide to show you how to build this weapon so you can tear through bosses without breaking a sweat. .

Pros and Cons of Marais Executioner's Sword

Pros

Cons

+ Unique combination of mechanics in Ash of War makes it great to buff

- Long charge time

+ High base damage

- Stuck in Ash of War animation for a while

+ Deals Magic and Physical damage

- Requires high Arcane to use

+ Decent reach

- It's okay for PvP

+ Best used for PvE

+ Final hit of Ash of War can be canceled with a roll

Marais Executioner's Sword is a legendary greatsword with a decent moveset behind it, but its real draw is its Ash of War -- Eochaid's Dancing Blade Skill . If you tap the Ash of War button, it'll quickly send the sword out directly in front of you and spin like a drill. Your Tarnished will then take the weapon back into their hands and swipe at the enemy once. This attack can be charged by holding down the Ash of War button to deal more hits. Since this attack is chargeable, hits in rapid succession, counts as a dance, and deals a significant chunk of magic damage, Eochaid's Dancing Blade has several different routes to buff its already high damage to reach its infamously boss-shredding potential.

However, despite its mind-blowing damage, there are still a few weaknesses to take into account when you're building this weapon. The Ash of War must be fully charged to deal the damage you're building for. This means your Tarnished will be stuck in the same spot during the charge animation and stuck in the same spot while the animation plays out. Against enemy Tarnished, Eochaid's Dancing Blade will leave you painfully vulnerable if they dodge the drill or interrupt you while you're charging. You could use the fast version of this Ash of War, but it's still easy for most opponents to dodge since it only attacks the area directly in front of you. In PvE, standing still for its attack can be problematic since you still have to find the right time and place to charge up the attack without your targets interrupting you.

Despite those downsides, Marais Executioner's Sword is still a good weapon. If you're helping a friend fight off an invader, the Executioner's Sword can still catch an invader off-guard if they get sloppy. High poise, careful timing, and good spacing can also help make up for the long charge time leading into the attack. But this weapon truly shines in PvE where big-bodied, slow enemies will give you plenty of opportunities to let a fully charged drill rip through them.

Best Off-hand Weapon with Marais Executioner's Sword.

  • Greatshield: Makes the most of your high strength stat and provides plenty of defense
  • Bleed Iron Greatsword: Power stance weapon that can deal bleed
  • Seal or Staves: These two options are primarily used for buffs. Blood-based spells can also be used to take advantage of your high Arcane.
  • Madding Hand: Best used for self-inflicted madness buffs like Howl of Shabriri .

There are a few different options to use in your off-hand. If you prefer to stay behind a shield, a Great Shield without an Ash of War is a great option since it gives you the opportunity to block attacks until you see a good opening to use Eochaid's Dancing Blade.

A second greatsword to powerstance this weapon can also help your damage output if you're up against a faster enemy, or if that's your preferred style into PvP. A Bleed Iron Greatsword in particular strikes a good balance of damage and inflicting bleed damage, which you can use for bleed-based buffs like Lord of Blood's Exultation , or just to get more value out of your high Arcane stat.

The Madding Hand is here just for its ability to buff your damage. Even if you don't have the stats for it, equip the Madding Hand to your off-hand and use a seal in your main hand. Use Shabriri's Howl until you're inflicted with Madness, then swap your main hand back to Marais Executioner's Greatsword. If you plan on two-handing this Greatsword and investing into a madness build, this is the perfect off-hand weapon to get even more damage out of your build.

Best Stats for Marais Executioner's Sword

Vigor

50 - 60

Mind

X

Endurance

20+

Strength

80

Dexterity

14

Intelligence

20 if you're going over level 150

Faith

33 if you're going over level 150

Arcane

50

At level 150, you'll want to focus on reaching 80 Strength and 50 Arcane . This will reach the soft cap for both stats, and you'll maximize how much damage Marais Executioner's Sword will deal. If you plan to go over level 150, look for increasing Faith up to 33 so you can use Howl of Shabriri , Black Dumpling , Madding Hand , and Aged One's Exultation for a massive boost to your overall damage.

If you have any points to spare, having 20 intelligence isn't a bad idea just to get access to Terra Magica . This is a spell that increases all magic damage dealt in its sigil, including from melee weapons. Since Marais Executioner's Sword also deals magic damage, this results in a staggering 22.5% increase in your magic damage.

Best Armor for Marais Executioner's Sword

In Shadow of the Erdtree , Tarnished gained access to the Dancer's set, a new special armor set that increases the damage of all dancing attacks by 2.5% for each piece worn. You can wear the gloves, boots and chest piece for an 7.5% increase to Eochaid's Dancing Blade's damage. For your helmet, wear either the White Mask or Black Dumpling depending on whether you want to try using bleed or madness for an additional damage buff.

If you don't plan to use bleed or madness, you can use the Rakshasa Helm or the Dancer's Hood to increase your damage. Rakshasa is better if you want a more general increase to your damage, while the Dancer's Hood is better if you want to focus on just your Ash of War's damage.

Best Talismans For Marais Executioner's Sword

Millicent's Prosthesis/Rotten Winged Sword Insignia

Both Millicent's Prosthesis and the Rotten Winged Sword Insignia shine in almost any build that wants to attack quickly and often, it has a particular home with the Marais Executioner's Sword. Since Eochaid's Dancing Blade deals so many hits so quickly, it's fairly easy to activate both of these talismans in a single activation of your Ash of War.

You can only get one of these talismans per game since you can only complete Millicent's Quest once. Getting both requires you to enter New Game+.

Shard of Alexander

This talisman is practically a staple Marais Executioner's Sword. Since the majority of your damage comes from your Ash of War, Shard of Alexander is a straightforward 15% damage buff for your build.

Godfrey's Icon

Godfrey's Icon increases the damage of all charged attacks by 15%. Tor all intents and purposes, this talisman is practically a second copy of Shard of Alexander for Marais Executioner's Sword. If you're playing PvP however, this talisman's slot can be a flex spot since you won't be landing too many full-charged Ash of War attacks against player-controlled Tarnished.

Aged One's Exultation

The Aged One's Exultation talisman is best used with a madness build for huge, chunky damage. Combine this talisman with the Black Dumpling helmet, Madding Hand , and Howl of Shabriri so you can get the biggest buff possible. With all of these items combined, you'll receive a 55% increase to your damage after inflicting madness on yourself through Howl.

While this talisman and the madness tools are good, this is only useful if you're willing to put in the faith investment for Howl of Shabriri . Otherwise,this talisman is a subpar choice if you want to use a build that focuses on something else other than madness. In that case, you can replace it with the Lord of Blood's Exultation if you plan on using Bleed instead, or a Magic Scorpion Charm if you're looking to increase your Magic damage.

Best Cracked Tears With Marais Executioner's Sword

  • Stonebarb Cracked Tear : Increases your poise damage, allowing you to stagger enemies more easily and link Eochaid's Dancing Blades into each other
  • Thorny Cracked Tear : Acts like Millicent's Prosthesis and Rotten Winged-Sword Insignia and increases your damage for fast, successive hits
  • Magic-shrouding Cracked Tear : Increases your magic damage.

item.title: Best Strategy Games With Dragons
item.description:
Highlights

  • Strategy games encompass various sub-genres, often featuring recruitable units like dragons for added excitement.
  • Games like Kingdoms And Castles and Divinity creatively include dragons, either as enemies or as controllable units.
  • Titles like Total War: Warhammer 2 and Age Of Wonders 4 offer players the chance to recruit and command dragon units.

Strategy games cover a broad and varied number of sub-genres, but many of them feature recruitable units or some form of unit management. Many strategy games take on a fantasy theme, but, unfortunately, not all of them feature dragons.

This is a shame, as dragons are an iconic part of fantasy. However, although some games choose to omit dragons, others embrace them. From defending against ferocious dragon enemies in Kingdoms And Castles to recruiting the dragons themselves, strategy games have been creatively including dragons for years.

7 Kingdoms And Castles

Defending A Kingdom Against Dragons

Kingdoms And Castles is a city-building strategy game that tasks players with building and defending a castled town from waves of bloodthirsty Vikings and fire-breathing dragons. The game features a bright and colorful art style and engaging city-building mechanics that make managing the town and the people within its walls an engaging task.

Kingdoms And Castles also features base defense gameplay, tasking players with building static defenses and armies to fight off the dual threat of the Vikings and dragons. The different strategies required to survive and overcome these unique threats ensure players are kept on their toes throughout, constantly working to better defend their miniature kingdom.

6 Divinity: Dragon Commander

Commanding Armies While Controlling A Dragon

Divinity: Dragon Commander is a creative combination of third-person action, RPG systems, and real-time strategy. The game focuses on building and managing armies, conquering territory via a world map not dissimilar to Total War . Most notably, however, players are able to take control of a dragon during each battle, allowing Divinity: Dragon Commander to offer unique gameplay.

Outside of its dragon combat, however, Divinity: Dragon Commander is a relatively straightforward real-time strategy game. For hardcore fans of the genre, it may lack challenge, but for players that enjoy more lightweight experiences, Divinity: Dragon Commander is consistently engaging.

5 Total War: Warhammer 2

Massive Battles In An Iconic Fantasy Setting

Total War games are known for their blend of turn-based, over-world campaigns and large-scale real-time strategy battles. Many of these games take on a historical theme, but the Total War: Warhammer franchise takes the fantastical world of Warhammer and combines it with Total War's iconic gameplay. There are currently three Total War: Warhammer games available, but the second game in the trilogy is arguably the best.

Total War: Warhammer features a variety of playable factions, each with their own units. Dragons are predominantly used by the High Elves but can be recruited by a select few factions outside of them. These creatures inflict terror and some can also be mounted by characters.

4 Age Of Wonders 4

A Stylish High-Fantasy Strategy Game With Dragon Units

This 4X grand strategy game takes place in a stylish fantasy setting and is packed with strategic choices and tactical turn-based combat encounters. Age Of Wonders 4 features a dynamic event system that drives the game forward and provides narrative context for the strategic layer, while the deep levels of customization and large variety of units keep the game's replay value high.

In keeping with its high fantasy setting, Age Of Wonders 4 features dragon and wyvern units. Furthermore, Age Of Wonders 4 also features a dragon-focused expansion in the form of paid DLC, appropriately titled Age Of Wonders 4: Dragon Dawn .

3 Heroes Of Might And Magic 3

Old-School Turn-Based Strategy With A Strategic Layer

Resource management, elements of grand strategy, and tactics all play important roles in Heroes Of Might And Magic . There have been a variety of games in the franchise, and every fan has a favorite, but it could be argued that Heroes Of Might And Magic 3 is where the series peaked.

Although Heroes Of Might And Magic 3 may appear inaccessible on the surface with its old-school visuals and busy user interface, it's a frequently engaging and consistently charming experience. As its title suggests, Heroes Of Might And Magic 3 is a fantasy-themed strategy game, and it features a large variety of high-fantasy units. Among its many units are a variety of recruitable dragons.

2 Stronghold Legends

Iconic RTS Gameplay With A Fantasy Twist

Though not quite as massive as RTS franchises such as StarCraft and Command & Conquer , Stronghold is a cornerstone of the real-time strategy genre and, more notably, a pioneer of base defense games. Although the original Stronghold took place in medieval England, FireFly Studios got creative with one of its later sequels, Stronghold Legends , which added fantasy elements inspired by myths and legends.

These fantasy elements include everything from frost giants and werewolves, all the way to wizards and, of course, dragons. For fans of both fantasy and the classic castle-sim gameplay of Stronghold , Stronghold Legends is worth a look.

1 Warcraft 3

A Classic Fantasy RTS With Dragon Units

The Warcraft franchise may be better known for the MMO, World Of Warcraft , but Warcraft 2 and Warcraft 3 are arguably among the best real-time strategy games of their time. Warcraft 3 provides players with colorful stylized graphics and creative, engaging campaigns that make it a relatively accessible real-time strategy game.

Set in a fantasy world, Warcraft 3 is able to provide players with fantastical locations, monsters, and creatures of all kinds. There are a variety of units across the game's variety of factions, and although dragons aren't always available as units, they can be recruited as mercenaries through a unique building known as a Dragon Roost.

item.title: 7 Open-World Games With The Best First-Person Shooter Gameplay, Ranked
item.description:
Highlights

  • The Front offers top-notch gunplay in a competitive PvP survival setting, with combat inside vehicles for added excitement.
  • 7 Days To Die provides challenging zombie survival combat, rewarding players who take the time to learn AI behavior.
  • The Forest delivers tough FPS combat, requiring strategic decisions and a mix of weapons for survival in a spooky setting.

Many open-world games focus on gameplay mechanics such as survival, exploration, resource gathering, and crafting. In these games, first-person combat takes something of a back seat, being just a way to defeat enemies to continue with other activities. But some games shift this focus, or ensure that the shooter gameplay is fully fleshed out.

What makes good FPS shooter gameplay though? Is it the weapons available? Skills that can improve combat capabilities? Or is it something as fundamental as gunplay feeling natural, well-coordinated, and rewarding? Possibly it is a combination of all these things and more. However, there are definitely some open-world games that got combat right.

7 The Front

Competitive PvP Survival

The Front is a competitive PvP survival shooter, that follows in the footsteps of games like Rust. Players compete for control of a fairly large open-world map. The gameplay follows a logical progression, with players constructing a basic base, and then working toward unlocking further technologies to upgrade the base.

The gunplay in The Front is excellent, as one would expect from a competitive PvP game. Furthermore, combat can take place in vehicles such as tanks and helicopters, with multiple players crewing them. Overall, for small teams, The Front is a fun game.

6 7 Days To Die

Zombie Survival At Its Best

As zombie survival games go, few offer such a complete and polished experience as 7 Days To Die . However, considering the game spent 11 years in early access, this is not really surprising. This game has it all. Challenging zombie encounters, missions, crafting, base building, and the fun Blood Moon tower defense gameplay.

Combat in 7 Days To Die is rewarding. This is not a game that forgives mistakes, and it is very easy to end up dead as a new player. It takes time to learn how the zombie AI reacts, and the common locations where zombies are hidden inside POIs. Luckily, the gunplay is great, and really rewards players that are willing to learn how to play well.

5 The Forest

Spooky Survival

The Forest isnâ€™t for everyone. This is a game that can be downright disturbing at times. Add to this the fact that simply staying alive in this game is a challenge, and you have a game that isnâ€™t really suited to casual play. Put simply, people either love or hate The Forest . Those that love it, generally end up investing hundreds of hours into the game.

The FPS combat in The Forest is tough. Primarily due to the fact that, in the early stages of the game, a player only has access to simple weapons such as a bow. Advanced weapons need to be retrieved from dangerous, hidden locations, which can be tough to get to. The trick with combat in The Forest is knowing when to run and not fight in many scenarios.

4 Destiny 2

Popular MMORPG

Destiny 2 is the only game on this list that can be termed a true MMO. This sci-fi shooter has a lot to offer. The base game is free to play, and there is a ton of content available for free players. The open-world aspects of this game involve firstly, the ability to travel around the galaxy to different planets and locations, and secondly, the world maps at these locations are also open-world in most respects.

Combat in Destiny 2 can be fast and furious, with enemies spawning on all sides in the most frantic zones. Players can select from an impressive lineup of weaponry, armor, and equipment to improve their combat capabilities and progress their character.

3 Grand Theft Auto 5

Slick And Stylish

Out of the box, Grand Theft Auto 5 places the player in third-person mode. However, for people who prefer first-person combat, there is a hotkey for switching the view. However, most players use a combination of both views, sticking to the third-person view when exploring the open-world map, and using the first-person view for combat.

Gunplay in Grand Theft Auto 5 is more tactical than brutal. Players need to utilize cover to avoid being hit, only popping out of cover to return fire. AI enemies will try to flank, meaning the player needs to stay aware of what is going on around them in combat.

2 Red Dead Redemption 2

Wild West Gunplay

Of all periods of history, the Wild West is the most synonymous with gunplay. There are few Western movies that donâ€™t have at least a few gunfights. Red Dead Redemption 2 brings the Wild West to life, in a game that has something to offer everyone, from fishermen to bank robbers.

The gunplay in Red Dead Redemption 2 is fantastic. This is another game that drops the player into third-person view by default, but has a key bind to switch to first-person. Quickdrawing an army Colt revolver, or pumping a fresh round into the chamber of a Winchester rifle is a truly iconic experience. Whether fighting AI enemies, hunting animals, or battling other players online, it takes skill to wield weapons well in Red Dead Redemption 2 .

1 Fallout 4

Rich Open World Combat

Fallout 4 is seen by many people as the pinnacle of Bethesda's world-building prowess. With its great open-world, post-apocalyptic map, it sets the scene for some fun and frantic FPS combat. This is a game that doesnâ€™t take itself too seriously, and this is apparent in the often humorously named weapon selection.

First-person combat gameplay in Fallout 4 seems quite simple at first. It isnâ€™t until a player progresses far enough to begin entering the dangerous POIs such as underground bunkers that the complexity comes into play. Put simply, players canâ€™t just stand and shoot in Fallout 4 , they need to think about cover, and the impact of stealth as well.

item.title: Once Human: How To Get The Frozen Northern Pike
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Get The Frozen Northern Pike Blueprint In Once Human
  • How To Craft The Frozen Northern Pike

Among the many unique melee weapons in Once Human , the Frozen Northern Pike stands out as the most ridiculous of the bunch. However, despite its nature, it's actually very effective at beating down anything that comes a little too close for comfort.

Getting the Frozen Northern Pike isn't quite as simple as the other melee weapons in Once Human . It's well worth the effort, though, especially if you're using an Elemental build that focuses on the Frost Vortex effect.

How To Get The Frozen Northern Pike Blueprint In Once Human

Unlike many other melee weapon in the game, you can't get the Frozen Northern Pike blueprint just by opening mystic crates in Once Human . Instead, you have to buy it from Margerie, the NPC in charge of selling fishing-related items. She appears on many different piers all over the map, but if you want the Frozen Northern Pike blueprint, you need to visit her at the makeshift pier at the beach in the Red Sands region, the one on the eastern edge of the map. It's right next to the Blackheart region border.

To get the blueprint, you'll need to trade 10 Northern Pikes to Margerie, something that's likely going to take a while. For the sake of actually crafting the frozen pike, make sure to get one extra fish.

Where To Get Northern Pikes

One good spot for fishing Northern Pikes is the very same beach where you find Margerie in Red Sands. Walk some ways down south, and find a rock to stand on. Fishing in Once Human can be a little tedious, but the mechanics are simple enough to keep things from getting too frustrating. We strongly recommend using Dough bait here.

If you're having trouble getting Northern Pikes, here are a few tips you can try out:

  • Move your camera in small increments when trying to reel fish in.
  • Don't forget to move your camera up and down if the fish is moving laterally.
  • You can see what fish takes your bait. If it's not a Northern Pike, press ESC and try again to save time.
  • Even if both the line and fish status bars get depleted, don't let go of your mouse button. There's a chance that the fish will still get reeled in.

How To Craft The Frozen Northern Pike

You can make this frozen fish weapon the same way you make guns in Once Human â€” just go to any Gear Workbench, and check the melee weapons tab. However, you can only craft the high-tier versions of it in an Advanced Gear Workbench. To make the Tier V version of the Frozen Northern Pike, all you need are 12 Ice Cubes and 1 Northern Pike. To make Ice Cubes, you'll need to put some Purified Water inside a Fridge. Put some Dirty Water in a Water Purifier, and wait for a few minutes.

The Frozen Northern Pike is more than just a joke weapon. Heavy attacks with this frozen fish will simultaneously freeze your main target and spawn a Frost Vortex by their feet, dealing major Frost DMG over a short duration to anything inside the vortex.

item.title: Green Hell: Best Food, Ranked
item.description:
Highlights

  • For players seeking high protein levels in Green Hell, cooking Tapir Meat provides a perfect balance of nutrients, energy, and sanity boosts.
  • Harvesting Heart of Palm from Young Palm Trees offers a versatile option for maintaining energy levels while exploring the Amazon rainforest.
  • Peccary Meat is a robust choice for survival, offering rich protein and fat values that can be enhanced through various preparation methods.

For hardcore survival game fans, Green Hell is one of the most challenging options available on the market. In this game, characters are stranded in the Amazon rainforest and must use all their skills to survive the challenges that affect both body and mind.

Green Hell also features a consistent nutrition mechanic where players need to obtain foods that maintain attributes like Carbohydrates, Fats, Proteins, and Hydration to keep the player character alive. However, for better results, it is crucial that players understand what the best foods in Green Hell actually are.

10 Tortoise Meat Cooked

Provides High Protein But Hard To Find

  • Needs Gain: +48 Protein, +15 Energy
  • Habitats: Forest edge and river beds

Since they are not usually found in the game's starting area and require some exploration of the map to locate, Red Footed Tortoises are somewhat rare, but their cooked meat provides a good amount of protein and energy. For characters needing substantial boosts in these values, this is one of the best food options in Green Hell .

These tortoises can be found near riverbeds at the edge of the forest, and their colorful appearance makes them easy to spot in this environment. Additionally, they are slow-moving, making them easy targets for players who can take them down with a single hit.

9 Green Iguana Meat Cooked

Provides Some Protein

  • Needs Gain: +28 Protein, +10 Energy
  • Habitat: Forest

Like other foods in Green Hell , iguana meat can be prepared in various ways, but for players seeking a higher protein gain, cooking is the best preparation method. Despite its short shelf life of only two days before spoiling, it provides 28 protein.

Iguanas can be found throughout the forested areas in Green Hell , but players need to be cautious, as they tend to flee when sensing danger, and their green bodies blend into the surroundings. It is recommended to use ranged weapons or set traps in strategic spots to capture them.

8 Heart Of Palm

A Good Source Of Carbohydrates And Hydration

  • Needs Gain: +28 Carbohydrates, +2 Protein, +20 Hydration
  • Habitat: Young Palm Tree

For players looking for a versatile alternative in Green Hell , the Heart of Palm stands out as a nutritious and easy-to-obtain option. Harvesting this part of the Young Palm Tree provides 45 Carbohydrates and 20 Hydration, along with 2 Protein. These attributes make the Heart of Palm an excellent choice for maintaining the character's energy while exploring the dense Amazon rainforest.

In addition to being consumed raw, the Heart of Palm can be used to prepare a brew that, while sacrificing protein and hydration, offers 10 Energy. Players can obtain this item by cutting down a Young Palm Tree, usually found in various areas of the forest, making it one of the best foods in Green Hell to ensure survival.

7 Unknown Bulb

A Reliable Source Of Carbohydrates

  • Needs Gain: +50 Carbohydrates, +5 Energy (cooked)
  • Habitat: Under the Malanga Plant

The Malanga Bulb is one of the best foods in Green Hell for players who need a quick and efficient source of carbohydrates. Harvested from the Malanga Plant and consumed raw, it offers 50 Carbohydrates but also causes food poisoning, making it risky for direct consumption.

Cooking the Malanga Bulb is the safest and most advantageous option, as it retains the 50 Carbohydrates and adds 5 Energy without posing health risks to the character. Its easy availability and the benefits it provides make it an essential food for those aiming to survive in the Amazonian jungle of this survival game.

6 Banana

An Abundant Source Of Carbohydrates

  • Needs Gain: +25 Carbohydrates
  • Habitat: Banana Tree

Bananas are among the best foods in Green Hell due to their abundance and easy accessibility. While they provide 25 Carbohydrates (a relatively low amount compared to other foods), their constant presence on the map ensures that players always have a reliable energy source at their disposal.

Their ease of access, combined with a short spoilage time of just two days, makes bananas a strategic choice for maintaining carbohydrate levels during exploration of the Amazon rainforest. Additionally, bananas can be used as seeds for cultivation or as fertilizer, offering continuous benefits throughout the game.

5 Unknown Nut

A Reliable Source Of Fat

  • Needs Gain: +15 Fats
  • Habitat(s): Raffia Palm

The Unknown Nut is one of the best fat sources in Green Hell , offering 15 Fats per unit. This food, which can be found occasionally falling from Raffia Palms, requires no cooking, making it a practical option for players wanting to maintain their character's health with minimal effort. Furthermore, its small size allows players to store a significant amount without compromising inventory space.

Another benefit of the Unknown Nut is its long shelf life, boasting a spoilage time of 3 days. This makes it ideal for extended journeys through the Amazon rainforest. It can also be planted in a Large Planting Box, providing a constant fat source. For those seeking an easy-to-handle and highly efficient item, the Unknown Nut is an indispensable choice in Green Hell .

4 Brazil Nut

The Ideal Source Of Fat

  • Needs Gain: +1 Carbohydrates, +35 Fats, +2 Proteins, +2 Sanity
  • Habitat: Base of the Brazil Nut Tree

The Brazil Nut is one of the best fat sources in Green Hell , providing 35 Fats per unit, along with small amounts of Carbohydrates and Proteins. It can be found at the base of the Brazil Nut Tree, usually in groups of three to four nuts, making it a reliable choice for players who need fat to stay alive.

In addition to being an excellent fat source, the Brazil Nut also offers a small sanity boost, making it essential for characters in critical situations. With a spoilage time of two days, it can be used effectively on long journeys, ensuring that players always have a nutritious and lasting food source available.

3 Peccary Meat

A Rich Source Of Protein And Fat

  • Needs Gain: +14 Fats, +52 Proteins, +8 Energy, +3 Sanity
  • Habitats: Areas with dense vegetation, usually in pairs

Peccary Meat is one of the best options for those seeking high protein and fat values in Green Hell . Found in densely vegetated areas, Peccaries are passive creatures that can be hunted using spears or traps. While the raw meat is already nutritious, drying it enhances its protein and fat content, making it an excellent energy source.

The meat's versatility in preparation methods offers different benefits depending on the approach. Cooking it provides a significant boost in energy and sanity, while smoking or drying it extends its shelf life, allowing players to store it for extended periods during their journeys. This makes it a robust choice for sustaining life in the Amazon rainforest.

2 Capybara Meat

An Excellent Source Of Protein And Fat

  • Needs Gain: +17 Fats, +60 Proteins, +8 Energy, +3 Sanity
  • Habitats: Dense forest areas and near rivers

Capybara Meat stands out as one of the best foods in Green Hell , offering a high concentration of essential proteins and fats for survival. Providing 60 Proteins and 17 Fats, it is ideal for maintaining both physical and mental strength during the long journeys through the Amazon rainforest.

The meat can be consumed in various ways, each offering distinct benefits. Cooking, for instance, not only provides a good amount of energy but also boosts sanity, crucial for overcoming the game's challenges. The meat's nutritional value and adaptability make it an indispensable choice for anyone seeking lasting and effective sustenance.

1 Tapir Meat Cooked

One Of The Best Options In The Game

  • Needs Gain: +24 Fats, +80 Proteins, +15 Energy, +5 Sanity
  • Habitat(s): Dense forests

In Green Hell , one of the most valuable options for ensuring survival is cooked Tapir Meat, offering an ideal balance of proteins and fats, along with energy and sanity boosts. These attributes make it an essential food for players facing long journeys through the Amazon jungle.

The Tapir is a passive creature, but hunting it can be challenging due to its size and its ability to blend into dense forests. However, the effort is worth it, as cooked meat provides long-lasting sustenance, crucial for maintaining both strength and mental health during the game's hardships.
